**Share Repurchase and Market Value Impact (Asymmetric Information)**

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false

set.seed(908)
library(webexercises)
library(knitr)

# Randomized firm parameters with asymmetric information
shares_outstanding <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 60, sd = 5), 2)  # random number of shares outstanding (million)
stock_price <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 26, sd = 3), 2)  # random price per share (dollars)
market_belief <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 1550, sd = 100), 2)  # market belief in firm value (million)
true_value <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 1600, sd = 120), 2)  # true firm value (million)
repurchase_amount <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 105, sd = 5), 2)  # random repurchase amount (million dollars)

# Price calculations
shares_repurchased <- round(repurchase_amount / stock_price, 2)  # shares repurchased in millions
shares_remaining <- round(shares_outstanding - shares_repurchased, 2)  # shares outstanding after repurchase
```


Gamma Corp. has `r shares_outstanding` million shares outstanding, and its stock is currently trading at `r stock_price` per share. The true value of the firm is `r true_value` million, but the market believes it is worth `r market_belief` million. The company plans to repurchase `r repurchase_amount` million worth of its own shares. Calculate: (a) the number of shares repurchased; and (b) the number of shares outstanding after the repurchase.
